column4: does ubuntu have an easy way to add remote locations to the fstab? or is it manual editing?
manual
doesn't add anything to fstab
ok. is there some helper app?
no,
you need to setup samba, and a samba auth system
so just using the "shared folders" part of the admin won't do the job?
it should do, does it give you an option on "how" to share
no. it just gives me the option to add dirs. when i was using kde/gentoo, i had all the options available. yes I can edit the smb.conf file, but I'd like to see how ubuntu "should" do it
hdparm
heh
hdparm doesn't seem to give me a way to see what the spindown time is
hdparm -B
I don't know if it will get it, I think your just supposed to set it to what you want
the point is i want to see what it is currently.
I (maybe wrongly) assumed disks came with it disabled and disks set it
ok, so you've got CFLAGS="-Wall" and CXXFLAGS-"-Wall" too ?
try setting it to 255 (disable) and see if it spins the disk down
sorry, wrong person
ok
pschorf sorry, my typing is sloppy today for some reason
no worries
